articles.title: UCSB Student Arrested On Charges of False Imprisonment
articles.description: Liu is scheduled to be a full time student with junior standing for Fall Quarter 2018.
articles.content:
A UC Santa Barbara student and Isla Vista resident was arrested on Saturday for false imprisonment and corporal injury of a spouse/cohabitant/date, according to police arrest logs.

Alan Liu, 21, was arrested by Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) deputies around 8 p.m. Saturday night on the 6500 block of Seville Road in I.V.

False imprisonment is defined as the “unlawful violation of the personal liberty of another,” according to the California legislative information website.

He was booked on a $50,000 bail and is currently in custody.

Liu is scheduled to be a full time student with junior standing for Fall Quarter 2018, according to the UCSB student verification website.

SBSO spokesperson Kelly Hoover could not release additional details.

Print
Evelyn Spence

Evelyn Spence harbors a great love for em dashes and runs on nothing but iced coffee, Jolly Ranchers and breaking news. She serves as the managing editor and can be reached at evelyn@dailynexus.com, managing@dailynexus.com or at @evelynrosesc on Twitter.

articles.title: Former SBCC Student Arrested On Burglary Charge in I.V.
articles.description: Dornan has since been released, according to the Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) website.
articles.content:
A 23-year-old former Santa Barbara City College student was arrested on Sunday in Isla Vista by Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s deputies on a first-degree attempt to commit burglary.

Tyler Dornan was also charged with committing a felony offense while out on bail.

Dornan was arrested on the 6600 block of Trigo Rd. after neighbors observed him removing a screen from a window, according to I.V. Foot Patrol Sergeant Daniel Calderon.

He was also seen “manipulating door handles of parked cars in the area,” Calderon said.

Dornan’s statement as well as witness testimony indicate that he was attempting burglary, Calderon said.

He was booked in the Santa Barbara Southern Branch Jail on a $75,000 bail.

He has since been released, according to the Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) website.

Dornan was last enrolled at Santa Barbara City College (SBCC) in 2015, according to SBCC representative Amanda Jacobs.

Evelyn Spence contributed reporting.

Print
Tamari Dzotsenidze

Tamari Dzotsenidze, Managing Editor, first started at the Daily Nexus her first quarter freshman year as an assistant news editor. When not in the dungeon under Storke tower, she likes to make weird art and go to the beach with her dog Duke.

articles.title: One Suspect Still At Large Following Attempted I.V. Robbery
articles.description: Mendoza and his vehicle were found on the 6700 block of El Colegio Road, where he was arrested.
articles.content:
A 18-year-old Isla Vista resident was arrested by police Thursday morning for robbery, conspiracy and assault with a deadly weapon, according to the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office.

Marco Mendoza is one of two suspects in an attempted robbery that occurred on the 700 block of Camino Del Sur at approximately 11 a.m., according to Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) Spokesperson Kelly Hoover.

Mendoza is an 18-year-old I.V. resident. Courtesy of SBSO

Mendoza is not a student at UC Santa Barbara, according to the UCSB student directory. Mendoza is an applicant at Santa Barbara City College (SBCC) but has not enrolled in classes, according to SBCC spokesperson Kirsten Mathieson.

Two suspects in a pick-up truck approached a man biking and accused the bicyclist of “committing crimes in the area,” Hoover said in a press release.

Mendoza, the driver of the truck, then threatened the victim with a knife. The victim discarded his bicycle and began to call for help.

As Mendoza attempted to take the bike, other residents of the apartment complex were drawn outside by the noise, Hoover said.

The second suspect ran away through an alley while Mendoza drove away in his truck, almost hitting one of the residents who came outside to help.

Mendoza and his vehicle were found on the 6700 block of El Colegio Road, where he was arrested. He is currently being held at the Santa Barbara County Jail on a $100,000 bail.

The second suspect has not yet been found.

Anyone with information about this incident can call the Sheriff’s Criminal Investigations Division at 805-681-4150. Individuals can also leave an anonymous tip at 805-681-4171 or on the SBSO website.

Updated 1:49 p.m.

This article will be updated.

Print
Sanya Kamidi

Sanya Kamidi serves as the Deputy News Editor and before that was a Social Media Manager. Loves coffee and will find any excuse to miss class for the Nexus.

articles.title: Suspect Arrested for Assault With a Deadly Weapon
articles.description: The suspect argued with the staff and “brandished” a knife when approached.
articles.content:
A suspect was arrested under a charge of assault with a deadly weapon after he brandished a knife to an apartment complex staff member in Isla Vista, resulting in a dispute that caused minor injuries.

The incident occurred at about 7:50 p.m. on Saturday when the UC Police Department received a report from a Tropicana Gardens staff member of a resident “acting strangely,” according to an alert sent out by the UC Santa Barbara Police Department (UCPD).

The suspect was identified as 29-year-old Whari Lewis, according to Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) arrest records.

The suspect argued with the staff and “brandished” a knife when approached. After a “struggle,” a staff member was struck with a lamp causing minor injuries.

The suspect was later contacted by law enforcement, arrested and booked at the Santa Barbara County Jail on a $30,000 bail.

The suspect is not affiliated with UCSB. He was described as an African-American male with black hair weighing approximately 200 lbs and is about 5 feet and 10 inches tall.

UCPD is investigating the crime and asks the public to provide any information that might aid the investigation by calling (805) 893-3446 or by reporting anonymously here.

Updated: This article was updated to include the suspect’s name. 

Print

articles.title: Multiple Stabbings Reported in Isla Vista
articles.description: The victims include an 18-year-old from Santa Barbara and a 17-year-old and 14-year-old from Goleta.
articles.content:
Police are investigating the stabbings of three male juveniles Wednesday night near Estero Park in Isla Vista.

Phi Do / Daily Nexus

The victims include an 18-year-old from Santa Barbara and a 17-year-old and 14-year-old from Goleta.

The incident occurred at approximately 9 p.m. on the 800 block of Camino Del Sur, according to Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office spokesperson Kelly Hoover.

Sheriff’s deputies and UC Santa Barbara police officers responded to the scene after the Santa Barbara County Public Safety Dispatch Center received a report of “several male subjects fighting and two that were in need of medical help,” Hoover said in a release.

When law enforcement arrived, they found an 18-year-old male and a 14-year-old male “lying on the sidewalk with multiple stab wounds,” Hoover said.

The two victims were transported to Goleta Valley Cottage Hospital. Shortly after, deputies learned that a 17-year-old male from Goleta with stab wounds had been driven to the hospital by friends and was receiving medical care.

The victims are recovering from their injuries. Their current conditions are unknown, Hoover said.

The incident is currently under investigation. Sheriff’s deputies have secured the crime scene and are investigating the circumstances leading up to the incident to determine and locate the suspect.

It is unknown at this time how many attackers were involved.

Anyone with information about this incident can call the Sheriff’s Criminal Investigations Division at 805-681-4150. Individuals can also leave an anonymous tip at 805-681-4171 or on the SBSO website.

Updated at 12:15 p.m.

Print

articles.title: Suspected Golden State Killer Arrested, Linked With Goleta Murders
articles.description: Sacramento County Police arrested the suspected “Golden State Killer,” Joseph James DeAngelo, who allegedly committed multiple crimes in Goleta and across California, on April 24.
articles.content:
Sacramento County Police arrested the suspected “Golden State Killer,” Joseph James DeAngelo, who allegedly committed multiple crimes in Goleta and across California, on April 24.

DeAngelo is linked to four murders in Goleta.

DeAngelo, a former police officer in Auburn and Visalia, is linked by DNA to homicides in Goleta in 1981 and is also believed to be responsible for two other murders and two attempted murders in 1979 in Goleta, according to the Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO).

The 72-year-old suspect was living in Citrus Heights, California at the time of his arrest.

In total, DeAngelo is tied to 51 rapes and 12 murders, according to Bruce Harrington, a brother and brother-in-law of two of the victims from Orange County.

In addition to the 51 rapes and 12 murders, DeAngelo is also potentially linked to hundreds of burglaries that occurred between the late ‘70s to the mid ‘80s, according to SBSO.

DeAngelo is suspected to have attacked a Goleta couple in 1979 while they were asleep at home. While both victims were able to escape, DeAngelo “evaded capture,” according to SBSO.

On Dec. 30, 1979, two people were murdered in their residence near Goleta, according to a SBSO press release. Two people were also found murdered in a home that they had been housesitting near Goleta on July 27, 1981, the press release stated.

“As we commence the charging and prosecution of DeAngelo, this too, will be a team effort involving many jurisdictions working collaboratively and collectively together,” Ventura County District Attorney Gregory Totten said at a press conference held by the Sacramento District Attorney’s office on Wednesday.

After his brother’s death, Harrington struggled to “bring DNA in California to the forefront of forensic crime scene investigation tools.”

In the early 2000s, he appeared before the Assembly, the Senate and Public Safety Committees in Sacramento, working to appeal to them about using DNA in their investigation.

“To the entire reservoir of victims out there, my sadness is with you. For the 51 ladies who were brutally raped in this crime scene, sleep better tonight. He isn’t coming through the window,” Harrington said at the press conference.

Alameda County District Attorney Nancy O’Malley said that while not all of the crimes linked to DeAngelo were purely based on DNA, they are all believed to be tied to him by “his modus operandi or by DNA.”

In total, DeAngelo is suspected to be responsible for crimes across 10 counties: Sacramento County, San Joaquin County, Stanislaus County, Yolo County, Contra Costa County, Santa Clara County, Alameda County, Santa Barbara County, Ventura County and Orange County.

Print
Sanya Kamidi

Sanya Kamidi serves as the Deputy News Editor and before that was a Social Media Manager. Loves coffee and will find any excuse to miss class for the Nexus.

articles.title: Suspect Arrested in Sexual Assault on UCSB Campus
articles.description: A student was raped on campus last Saturday, April 21, the UC Santa Barbara Police Department reported on Tuesday.
articles.content:
A student was raped on campus last Saturday, April 21, the UC Santa Barbara Police Department reported on Tuesday.

Police arrested the suspect one day later, according to a university alert sent to students on Tuesday afternoon.

The rape occurred this Saturday in the “early morning hours,” according to the alert.

The suspect was known to the victim and is described as a five-and-a-half-foot tall male with brown eyes and black hair.

The suspect is affiliated with UC Santa Barbara. UCPD is currently investigating the crime and requests anyone with information contact them at (805) 893-3446, or report information anonymously online at www.police.ucsb.edu/contact-us/report-crime.

Print
Tamari Dzotsenidze

articles.title: Court Requests Push iV Menus Owner’s Rape Hearing to June
articles.description: Galoustian, 45, was arrested in December on four felony charges, including kidnap to commit robbery or rape, rape of a drugged victim and two counts of oral copulation by use of force or injury.
articles.content:
Patrick Galoustian has owned iV Menus, a popular Isla Vista food delivery service, since 2008. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

A superior court judge ruled Thursday iV Menus owner Patrick Galoustian will have his preliminary hearing date setting on June 6 as the prosecution obtains further pre-trial evidence.

Galoustian, 45, was arrested in December on four felony charges, including kidnap to commit robbery or rape, rape of a drugged victim and two counts of oral copulation by use of force or injury. He is being held on combined $1.5 million bail. 

Before his arrest, Galoustian owned and operated iV Menus, a popular Isla Vista-based food delivery service, for nine years.

On Thursday afternoon, Judge Thomas R. Adams announced his decision to postpone Galoustian’s case to June 6, citing five outstanding requests for discovery by the prosecution. In the legal system, discovery is a method that either party can use to obtain more pre-trial evidence.

“We’ll get the actual discovery and be ready to rock and roll by the first weekend of June,” Adams told the courtroom.

After changing attorneys, Galoustian is now represented by Robert Sanger, who served as co-counsel for pop legend Michael Jackson in 2005 when the late idol was tried for child molestation. Galoustian was previously represented by Mindi Boulet.

Galoustian is a 2003 UC Santa Barbara alumnus. His preliminary setting hearing has been postponed three times after being originally scheduled on Jan. 11.

Updated April 6, 2:33 p.m.

Print

articles.title: I.V. Resident Arrested for Residential Burglary
articles.description: The suspect is not affiliated with UC Santa Barbara or Santa Barbara City College, according to SBSO spokesperson Kelly Hoover.
articles.content:
A 23-year-old Isla Vista resident was arrested on charges of residential burglary early Saturday morning, according to the Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO).

The suspect, Lovens Laurore, was arrested after SBSO responded to the report of a “burglary in progress” on the 6700 block of Del Playa at approximately 4:20 a.m., according to an SBSO press release sent out on Saturday night.

Laurore was arrested early Saturday morning for residential burglary. Courtesy of SBSO.

Laurore is not affiliated with UC Santa Barbara or Santa Barbara City College, according to SBSO spokesperson Kelly Hoover.

The victim called 911 after returning home and finding Laurore “rummaging through his apartment,” according to the press release.

Further investigation revealed that Laurore entered the residence through an unlocked door, according to the release.

Laurore had collected “several pieces of high-end clothing” and a MacBook computer before attempting to flee, but the victim and a housemate detained him until law enforcement officials arrived.

He is being held on a $50,000 bail at the Santa Barbara County Jail.

Sheriff’s deputies later discovered that Laurore is on probation for “possession of stolen property,” according to the press release.

SBSO is currently conducting an investigation.

Anyone with additional information is asked to call the I.V. Foot Patrol at 805-681-4179 or to leave an anonymous tip at 805-681-4171. An anonymous tip can also be submitted here.

Print
Evelyn Spence

articles.title: Female UCSB Student Wounded in Isla Vista Stabbing
articles.description: Law enforcement has not been able to locate the suspect, who fled the area before first responders arrived.
articles.content:
A female UC Santa Barbara student was wounded in a stabbing after a party in Isla Vista on Friday night.

Authorities blocked off the intersection of Del Playa Drive and Camino Del Sur following the incident. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

The incident occurred around 11 p.m. at a residence on the 6700 block of Del Playa Drive. The victim was stabbed in the pelvis, Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office Sgt. Brad Welch said in a release.

The suspect is described as a college-aged black male adult with dreadlocks and wearing a black sweatshirt, Welch said. Law enforcement has not been able to locate the suspect, who fled the area before first responders arrived.

The 24-year-old victim was provided care on the scene and then transported to the hospital.

Witnesses described an altercation between the suspect and the victim, but “their relationship is unknown at this time,” Welch said.

Authorities at the scene blocked off the intersection of Del Playa and Camino Del Sur with caution tape following the incident.

The incident is under investigation. Anyone with information can call the Isla Vista Foot Patrol at 805-681-4179 or leave an anonymous tip at 805-681-4171.  

Updated 1:55 a.m. 

Print

articles.title: Suspect in Friday Night I.V. Stabbing Arrested
articles.description: McClain is in custody at the Santa Barbara County Jail on charges of assault with a deadly weapon and bodily harm inflicted during the commission of a felony.
articles.content:
Police arrested McClain on Saturday afternoon after he went to the Isla Vista Foot Patrol station for questioning. Alex Gorman / Daily Nexus

A 19-year-old Isla Vista resident was arrested Saturday after allegedly stabbing a UC Santa Barbara student Friday night, the Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office reported.

Police arrested Cyrus Rocky McClain on Saturday afternoon after he went to the Isla Vista Foot Patrol station for questioning, according to an Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) press release.

McClain is being held in the county jail on $350,000 bail. Courtesy of SBSO

The stabbing of the 24-year-old-female student occurred at approximately 11 p.m. on the 6700 block of Del Playa Drive

in I.V. on Friday. Authorities blocked off the intersection of Del Playa Drive and Camino Del Sur following the incident.

An investigation revealed that the suspect did not know the victim, but had engaged in “an altercation with victim’s boyfriend” earlier in the night when McClain trespassed on the property, according to the release.

The victim was stabbed in the pelvis and transferred to Cottage Hospital shortly after medical personnel arrived at the scene.

The victim is recovering from non life threatening injuries, SBSO spokesperson Kelly Hoover said.

McClain is in custody at the Santa Barbara County Jail on charges of assault with a deadly weapon and bodily harm inflicted during the commission of a felony. He is being held on $350,000 bail.

SBSO sheriff’s deputies and UC Police Department officers worked “throughout the night” to locate and identify the suspect, according to the release. Several search warrants were issued in order to locate the suspect.

Print
Evelyn Spence

articles.title: New Report Calls 2014 I.V. Mass Murderer An “Alt-Right Killer”
articles.description: Investigations into Rodger’s internet posting history, along with his manifesto and the videos he uploaded to YouTube, led the SPLC to designate Rodger as a member of the alternative right.
articles.content:
On May 23, 2014, Rodger, then a second-year student at Santa Barbara City College, stabbed three of his housemates before driving through Isla Vista and opening fire on street-goers. Nexus File Photo

Elliot Rodger, who in May 2014 murdered six UC Santa Barbara students and wounded 14 others before taking his own life, was named a member of the alt-right in a report published Monday by the Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC).

Investigations into Rodger’s internet posting history, along with his manifesto and the videos he uploaded to YouTube, led the SPLC to designate Rodger as a member of the alternative right, which is typically defined as a far-right ideology that blends racist and white nationalist ideals.

The SPLC cites excerpts of Rodger’s manifesto and various posts on online forums. In his writing, Rodger bemoans his “inability to find a girlfriend,” condemns interracial couples and laments that a black man — “descended from slaves” — can “get a white girl,” while he cannot.

On May 23, 2014, Rodger, then a second-year student at Santa Barbara City College, stabbed three of his housemates before driving through Isla Vista and opening fire on street-goers. In the years since, he has become an internet meme on alt-right forums. Posters frequently invoke his memory to highlight misogynistic, anti-feminist ideology.

Rodger’s link to Nazi ideology was established as early as Feb. 2015 when the Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) released its full report on Rodger’s killing spree. Rodger searched the internet for phrases like “Adolf Hitler and the law of attraction,” “Nazi curbstomp” and “Holocaust of black people,” the Nexus reported.

Infamous white nationalist Richard Spencer coined the phrase “alt-right” as far back as 2008, but since the turn of the decade, the ideology has gained prominence, especially with the rise of meme culture and a surge in far-right sympathies in global politics.

In all, the SPLC listed 13 alt-right killers, including Dylann Roof, who in 2015 killed nine people in a historically black church in Charleston, South Carolina.

Print

articles.title: iV Menus Owner’s Preliminary Hearing Setting Scheduled for Feb. 15
articles.description: iV Menus owner Patrick Galoustian’s preliminary hearing setting was postponed to Feb. 15, a superior court judge ruled Thursday.
articles.content:
Galoustian was arrested on four felony charges following an assault that occurred at his residence on 910 Embarcadero Del Norte in Isla Vista. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus

iV Menus owner Patrick Galoustian’s preliminary hearing setting was postponed to Feb. 15, a superior court judge ruled Thursday.

Police arrested Galoustian in December on four felony charges, including kidnap to commit robbery or rape, rape of a drugged victim and two counts of oral copulation by use of force or injury. He is being held on $1 million bail.

The preliminary hearing setting was originally scheduled for Jan. 11 and has been postponed twice.

On Thursday morning, Judge Thomas R. Adams accepted two court documents relating to Galoustian’s case: statements from two unnamed individuals and an order for a blood test to be conducted on Galoustian.

Galoustian, 45, is a UC Santa Barbara alumnus. He has owned and operated iV Menus, an I.V. food delivery business, since 2008.

The UCSB Police Department (UCPD) is conducting an investigation on Galoustian.

Authorities have formally asked the public for information “about this investigation or other possible crimes committed by Mr. Galoustian during his 20-year residency in Isla Vista,” UCPD announced in a release.    

Print

articles.title: Suspect Arrested for Reported Rape in Isla Vista
articles.description: A woman was sexually assaulted by a male suspect at 910 Embarcadero Del Norte on  Dec. 17, the UC Santa Barbara Police Department reported.
articles.content:
The assault occurred at the suspect’s residence on 910 Embarcadero Del Norte in Isla Vista. Businesses at this address include Campus Cuts, Dublin’s Sports Grill, Precious Slut Tattoo and iV menus. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus

A woman was raped by a male suspect at 910 Embarcadero Del Norte on  Dec. 17, the UC Santa Barbara Police Department reported.

The suspect sexually assaulted the victim while she was unconscious at his residence in I.V., according to a UCSB “timely warning” that students received Tuesday.

UCPD identified and arrested a 45-year old white male.

The victim does not know the suspect, and neither the suspect or the victim are affiliated with UCSB, according to the alert.   

The police received the report Dec. 18 and sent out the alert to students Tuesday at 9:29 a.m.

This article will be updated as more information becomes available.

Print

articles.title: Two SBCC Students Arrested on Suspicion of Burglary
articles.description: Both suspects are Santa Barbara City College (SBCC) students, and McAllister is a former SBCC football player.
articles.content:
Two burglary suspects were arrested Monday afternoon after police found them at the Storke Ranch housing development near Isla Vista, the UC Police Department reported.

Cameron Lawson (above) was booked into the Santa Barbara County Jail on suspicion of attempted burglary and conspiracy. Kaitlyn Nguyen / Daily Nexus

Anthony McAllister, 20, and Cameron Lawson, 19, are suspected of stealing items from Tropicana Gardens residence hall in I.V. at about 1:00 a.m. Monday morning.

According to UCPD Sgt. Rob Romero, officers arrested the suspects at 4:40 p.m. Monday. He said that the suspects were “very compliant” and officers did not use force to detain them.

Both suspects are Santa Barbara City College (SBCC) students, and McAllister is a former SBCC football player.

McAllister was booked into Santa Barbara County jail on suspicion of burglary, attempted burglary, conspiracy and making criminal threats, according to UCPD. Lawson was booked on suspicion of attempted burglary and conspiracy.

The Santa Barbara Sheriff and California Highway Patrol assisted UCPD in surrounding the Storke Ranch housing complex and detaining the suspects. Kaitlyn Nguyen / Daily Nexus

The Santa Barbara County Sheriff and California Highway Patrol helped UCPD surround the housing complex and detain the suspects.

Law enforcement set a perimeter around the housing complex and blocked off roadways into the complex as they brought the suspects out of the building.

UC Santa Barbara sent out a university alert to students about the attempted burglary at 4:39 a.m. Monday morning.

McAllister challenged residents to fight when they confronted him, according to UCPD, and pulled an “unknown object” out of his pocket.

Residents told UCPD that McAllister then fled the apartment in an “unknown direction.”

Romero said McAllister was involved in an attempted burglary at Tropicana Gardens last week.

Print
